docs.lead_paragraph: Monologue | Aired Monday night on NBC: President Obama was in Japan. Some people are upset that Obama bowed to the Japanese emperor. It's still better than when former President Bush high-fived the emperor and said, "Give me some skin, Mr. Miyagi."
docs.abstract: Monologue | Aired Monday night on "The Tonight Show With Conan O'Brien": President Obama was in Japan. Some people are upset that Obama bowed to the Japanese emperor. It's still better than when former President Bush high-fived the emperor and said, "Give me some skin, Mr. Miyagi."

docs.lead_paragraph: Valentine's Day came a little early this week for donors to Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton, who sent them a thank-you email this afternoon that had a higher sugar count than a box of Godiva.
docs.abstract: The Democratic candidate gushes gratitude for all those donations that keep pouring in.
docs.snippet: The Democratic candidate gushes gratitude for all those donations that keep pouring in....

docs.lead_paragraph: Barack Obama has been trying to beef up his image for months, but the buzz is still about his beefcake side.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the latest issue of The New Yorker, Bill Clinton has some candid things to say to David Remnick about his wife's political future, coverage of their marriage by The Times, and his view of life since his heart attack. [No link, but David Remnick discusses the interview here.]
docs.abstract: Bill Clinton talks about Hillary, among other things, with The New Yorker.

docs.lead_paragraph: Heightening the disconnect between a state Democratic Party that largely opposes the Iraq war, and the planned coronation of Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton, who supported it, is a long-shot challenger and his modest proposal for an anti-war resolution.
docs.abstract: Heightening the disconnect between a state Democratic Party that largely opposes the Iraq war, and the planned coronation of Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton, who supported it, is a long-shot challenger and his modest proposal for an anti-war resolution. The resolution, being offered by Jonathan Tasini, caused a stir among the delegates in Buffalo, many of [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Dawn Ross, a daughter of Carol and Sander B. Ross of Pleasantville, N.Y., was married last evening to Daniel Roger Posternak, a son of Barbara and Michael Posternak of Armonk, N.Y. Rabbi David Greenberg officiated at the Jumeirah Essex House in New York. The bride and bridegroom have known each other since kindergarten in Armonk, and both are to begin studying for M.B.A. degrees this summer, she in August at Columbia and he in July at New York University.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Gail Greenman, the daughter of Geraldine and Herbert Greenman of Woodcliff Lake, N.J., was married last evening to Lance Aaron Milken, a son of Lori and Michael R. Milken of Encino, Calif. Rabbi Eli Herscher officiated at the Waldorf-Astoria in New York. The couple both graduated from the University of Pennsylvania, where they met.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: ''Fame a Two-Edged Sword for the Candidate Clinton'' (front page, Sept. 27) quotes a woman as saying she resented that Hillary Rodham Clinton wasn't strong enough to leave her husband after his affair, implying that Mrs. Clinton was a bad role model for women.
docs.abstract: Susan O Lund letter on Sept 27 article deplores woman who attacked Hillary Rodham Clinton for not leaving husband after his affair

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. and Mrs. Donald Mayer of Albany have announced the engagement of their daughter Hillary Lee Mayer to David Lee Jacobson, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Marvin Jacobson of Cranston, R.I. A May wedding is planned.
